column4: Hi, im in a bit of a predicament... I have 3 packages that need THEMSELVES to install One needs the other and the other the one before... arg***
how can I install them if each one of thm need the other as a dependency?
can you temporarily get broadband access to the machine?
have you already transfered all the necessary .deb files over?
i don't know of any kubuntu utility that will do that without net access
that will still use depencies.. i was thinking more like dpkg -i -f .. but I dont think thats enough
you see libxext-dev need x11proto which needs lin\bxi-dev which neds libxext-dev
